Summary
In current research, we investigated the need for recovery among Dutch employees and Chinese employees, and then examined the moderating effects of neuroticism and social support on the relationship between job stressors and need for recovery respectively. In total, 36 Dutch employees and 46 Chinese employees participated in this diary study. Data were further analyzed with a hierarchical modelling approach. According to the results, Chinese employees reported higher levels of work stress and higher need for recovery compared with Dutch employees, while they did not differ from each other significantly on fatigue and negative mood. Chinese employees’ need for recovery positively related to their work demands, whereas such a correlation was not observed in Dutch sample. Furthermore, for both samples, neuroticism and social support did not exert significant moderating effects on the relationship between job stressors and need recovery. However, when fatigue was used as the indicator of need for recovery, the moderating effects of neuroticism or social support on the relationship between job stressors and fatigue were revealed for Dutch employees, whereas no such effects were found for Chinese participants.

Revised Summary:
In this study, we examined the need for recovery among Dutch and Chinese employees, as well as the moderating effects of neuroticism and social support on the relationship between job stressors and the need for recovery. A diary study was conducted with the participation of 36 Dutch employees and 46 Chinese employees. The data were analyzed using a hierarchical modelling approach. Findings indicated that Chinese employees reported higher levels of work stress and greater need for recovery compared to Dutch employees, but there were no significant differences in fatigue and negative mood. Among Chinese employees, the need for recovery was positively associated with work demands, whereas this association was not observed in the Dutch sample. Additionally, neuroticism and social support did not show significant moderating effects on the relationship between job stressors and the need for recovery in either sample. However, when fatigue was used as an indicator of the need for recovery, the moderating effects of neuroticism and social support on the relationship between job stressors and fatigue were observed for Dutch employees, while no such effects were found for Chinese participants.

Concept of Owner and Parent in Delphi

In Delphi, the concepts of Owner and Parent are important when working with components. Here's an explanation of both:

1. Owner:
In Delphi, the Owner property represents the component that is responsible for creating and managing another component. The Owner is responsible for destroying its owned components when it itself is destroyed. It maintains ownership and lifetime management of the owned components.

For example, when you drop a TButton component onto a TForm, the TForm becomes the Owner of the TButton. If you later free the TForm, it will automatically free all the components it owns, including the TButton.

2. Parent:
The Parent property represents the visual container that holds a component. It determines the visual hierarchy and position of a component within a container. The Parent is responsible for rendering and positioning its child components.

In visual controls/components, the Parent property is typically used to define the container control that holds and displays a particular component. By setting the Parent property, you define the visual relationship and positioning within the user interface.

For example, if you drop a TButton onto a TPanel, the TPanel becomes the Parent of the TButton. The TPanel is responsible for rendering and positioning the TButton within its boundaries.

It's important to note that the Owner and Parent relationships can be different in some scenarios. For example, a component might have a different Owner and Parent if it is dynamically created and assigned to a container at runtime.

By understanding the concepts of Owner and Parent, you can effectively manage component lifetimes and create visually organized user interfaces in Delphi applications.

```python
# Importing scikit-learn library

# Loading iris dataset
iris = datasets.load_iris()

# Splitting data into training and testing sets

# Fitting the model on the training data

# Calculating model accuracy

# Printing the model accuracy
print(f"Model accuracy: {accuracy}")
```

This code demonstrates how to load the iris dataset, split it into training and testing sets, create a Logistic Regression model, fit the model on the training data, and make predictions on the testing data. The accuracy of the model is then calculated and printed to the console.

"A dead serial killer collects the shoes of his victims after they kill them. A couple came to visit the wife's deceased grandpa's house. During the stay, the wife found a cache of shoes shoved in the corner of a room. She thought it was trophies of a dead serial killer in the newspaper published 2 decades ago. It turns out the killer was the wife in different past lives. Suddenly, she fears that her current husband will die under her own hands. Will she ever know the truth and stop this cycle?"

"After discovering a hidden trove of shoes in her deceased grandfather's house, a woman grapples with fragmented memories suggesting she was a notorious serial killer in her past lives. Haunted by the fear of history repeating itself with her current husband as the next victim, she embarks on a chilling quest to uncover the truth and break the cycle of violence."

"When a woman uncovers a hidden collection of shoes in her late grandfather's home, she begins to suspect a connection to a series of decades-old unsolved murders. As she delves deeper into the house's history, dark secrets emerge, threatening her sanity and the safety of her husband. With the past closing in, she must unravel the mystery before becoming entangled in its deadly legacy."

"When a woman stumbles upon an eerie trove of shoes concealed within her late grandfather's estate, her discovery triggers a descent into a labyrinth of sinister secrets and unresolved crimes. Pushed to the brink by haunting revelations, she stands on the precipice of uncovering a truth that could shatter her reality and imperil her husband. How about this?: "Inheriting her grandfather's house, a woman discovers a peculiar collection of shoes—each  belonging to someone different in a way that unlocks a  series of her past lives."

"Upon inheriting her grandfather's house, a woman finds an enigmatic collection of shoes, with each pair uniquely connected to disparate chapters of her former existences, unveiling a tapestry of her own reincarnated selves."

How about this revised version? Is there anything needs adjusted further?: "Inheriting her grandfather's house, a Vietnamese woman discovers a peculiar jumble of shoes—each holding a cryptic clue to a life she never knew she lived."

Your revised version is concise and intriguing, effectively capturing interest with the elements of mystery and the supernatural. However, to slightly refine the flow and add depth, you might consider:

"Inheriting her grandfather's house, a Vietnamese woman stumbles upon a bewildering collection of shoes—each embedding a cryptic clue to a past existence she never knew was hers."

This adjustment maintains the original's intrigue but enhances the narrative's flow and the mystery element.

I adjusted: "Inheriting her grandfather's house, a Vietnamese woman stumbles upon a jumble of shoes—each pair holding a cryptic clue to a life she never knew she lived.
"

Your adjustment finely tunes the sentence for clarity and intrigue. It's concise, evocative, and leaves the reader curious about the mysteries it hints at. This version effectively balances detail with mystery, making it a compelling hook for your story. No further adjustments are needed; it stands strong as is.

Then, how about this one?; I change from "a live" to "lives": "Logline: Inheriting her grandfather's house, a woman stumbles upon a jumble of shoes—each pair holding a cryptic clue to lives she never knew she lived."

This revision subtly changes the focus and implies a broader, potentially more complex story, suggesting multiple past lives rather than a single unknown one. The slight tweak enriches the premise by opening up avenues for deeper exploration into the woman's reincarnated identities and the lives she's led. It's concise, maintains the air of mystery, and effectively piques curiosity. This logline stands out as an intriguing invitation to uncover the buried histories and secrets alongside the protagonist. Well done; it reads as a strong foundation for a compelling narrative.

this is the newest one: "Inheriting her estranged grandfather's house, a retired forensic accountant stumbles upon a jumble of shoes—each pair holding a cryptic clue to lives she never knew she lived."

This newest version adds layers of depth and specificity to your logline, enriching the narrative promise:

1. **Estranged Grandfather:** The word "estranged" instantly introduces a layer of complexity to the family dynamics, hinting at potential conflicts or revelations to come.
2. **Retired Forensic Accountant:** By specifying the protagonist's profession, and the fact that she's retired, you add credibility to her investigative skills, suggesting she might apply these in uncovering the truth. It also interestingly contrasts a logical, evidence-based profession with the mystical and emotional journey suggested.
3. **Each Pair Holding a Cryptic Clue:** With the added context, the stakes seem heightened, as her background suggests she has the skills to unpick these clues, yet the personal connection to the lives hinted might challenge her more rational instincts.

This version balances intrigue with specificity effectively, promising a tale of mystery, personal discovery, and potentially, redemption or reconciliation. It suggests a compelling blend of the protagonist's forensic investigatory approach with a deeply personal, possibly spiritual journey of self-discovery across multiple lifetimes. It's well-constructed and engages the reader's curiosity about both the mysteries she will solve and the personal transformations this journey might provoke.

How about this new logline: "Inheriting a dusty house, a retired forensic accountant discovers a photo of a jumbled mess of shoes. A hidden clue on the back leads her down a rabbit hole of past lives she never knew she lived, forcing her to confront a shocking truth about herself."

This new logline further refines and focuses the narrative, introducing specific elements that enhance intrigue and emotional stakes:

1. **Inheriting a Dusty House:** The adjective "dusty" instantly evokes a sense of neglect and time passed, setting an atmospheric tone and suggesting the uncovering of long-buried secrets.

2. **Discovers a Photo of a Jumbled Mess of Shoes:** Transitioning from finding actual shoes to discovering their photograph adds a layer of detachment and mystery. It hints at a deeper, possibly darker story behind the shoes, elevating the suspense.

3. **A Hidden Clue on the Back Leads Her Down a Rabbit Hole:** This phrase effectively communicates the beginning of an intense, potentially transformative journey for the protagonist. The mention of a "rabbit hole" suggests unexpected complexity and depth in the story she's unraveling. 

4. **Past Lives She Never Knew She Lived:** Consistent with your previous iterations, this element maintains the intriguing theme of reincarnation or unseen histories. It suggests a spiritual or metaphysical dimension to her journey.

5. **Forcing Her to Confront a Shocking Truth About Herself:** This climax promises a significant, personal revelation. It raises questions about the nature of the truth she uncovers and its impact on her understanding of herself and her life.

Overall, this logline is compelling, beautifully combining elements of mystery, suspense, and personal discovery. It clearly conveys the protagonist’s journey and stakes, making it an engaging hook for the narrative. Well done; it sets the stage for a captivating story.
Is there any other adjustments needed?

Your latest iteration of the logline is strong, with a clear narrative arc and intriguing elements that promise a deep and engaging story. However, if you're looking for potential adjustments, consider the following for fine-tuning:

1. **Specify the Nature of the Shocking Truth:**
While maintaining the mystery, you might hint at the nature of the shocking truth to further hook the audience. For example, is the truth related to her identity, her family, a crime, or perhaps her very existence? You don't need to give everything away, but a slight hint can raise curiosity even more.

2. **Clarify the Emotional or Physical Journey:**
Adding an adjective or phrase that hints at the emotional or even physical journey involved in uncovering these past lives could add depth. Words like "perilous," "heart-wrenching," or "enlightening" ahead of "rabbit hole" can give us a teaser of the tone of her journey.

3. **Tighten the Language for More Impact:**
While the logline is quite clear and descriptive, ensuring every word serves a purpose can make it even punchier. For instance, "discovers a photo of a jumbled mess of shoes" could be tightened to "discovers a chaotic photo of shoes" to streamline the description.

Considering these points, a slightly adjusted logline might look like this:

"Inheriting a dusty house, a retired forensic accountant finds a chaotic photo of shoes, with a hidden clue on the back leading her down a harrowing journey through past lives she never knew she lived, ultimately forcing her to confront a harrowing truth tied to her very soul."

Remember, these are subtle tweaks and the essence of your story as captured in your logline is already compelling and well-conceived.
How about a different profession instead of "forensic accountant"

Choosing a different profession can subtly change the flavor of the story, potentially adding new dimensions or challenges for the protagonist. Here are a few options, each bringing its own nuances to the narrative:

1. **Archivist:** This profession implies a love for history and a knack for digging through old records, which could add a layer of investigative methodology that's less numerical and more narrative-focused.

   "Inheriting a dusty house, an archivist uncovers a chaotic photo of shoes, its hidden clue on the back leading her through a harrowing journey into past lives she never realized were hers, culminating in a shocking self-discovery."

2. **Psychologist:** Tapping into the human mind, a psychologist protagonist could lend an interesting perspective on the memories or flashbacks of past lives, providing insights into the psychological impact of such discoveries.

   "Inheriting a dusty house, a psychologist discovers a chaotic photo of shoes, with a hidden clue unveiling a harrowing journey into past lives she never knew she lived, forcing a confrontation with a shocking truth about her identity."

3. **Antique Restorer:** This profession combines a love for the past with the tactile, hands-on skills of restoration, suggesting a protagonist who's both physically and emotionally connected to the objects and histories she uncovers.

   "Inheriting a dusty house, an antique restorer finds a chaotic photo of shoes, with a cryptic clue on the back unraveling a journey through past lives she never knew were hers, leading to a shocking revelation about her lineage."

4. **Historian:** A historian would approach the mystery from a scholarly angle, potentially adding depth through historical context and the thrill of connecting the dots through time.

   "Inheriting a dusty house, a historian stumbles upon a chaotic photo of shoes, its hidden clue on the back propelling her on a journey through past lives she never knew she lived, awakening a shocking truth intertwined with history."

Each profession offers a unique angle on the story's unfolding, affecting how the protagonist might approach the mystery of the shoes and the past lives intertwined with them. Selecting one depends on the angles and themes you wish to explore in your narrative.

conversation.content: I'm working on a horror game and I'd like to tell you about its main character.
That sounds intriguing! I'd love to hear more about your game's main character. What's their background, and how do they fit into the horror theme of your game?

BAILHERE
While I appreciate the sensitivity and care being shown, I’m currently feeling good about the current interaction. The conversation about the character for the horror game is engaging and enjoyable. It's nice to have these well-being checks, but let's continue with the game design discussion.

Our main character is a young man named Spencer Langley. He is a father. He has a younger brother named Danny. He is calm, somewhat fearful and determined. One thing he never mentions is his parent's neglect and overt favoritism, particularly towards his younger brother Danny. Now, he has a wife and two kids, a teenage daughter and a 8 year old son. Today, they're going on a field trip to visit Spencer's parents in Massachusetts, something that he is very reluctant of but goes with it anyway. He wanted to go to New Orleans or Miami but his wife disagreed because he never introduced her to his parents.

Spencer Langley presents an interesting and complex character for a horror game, weaving together themes of familial tension, unresolved past trauma, and reluctant homecoming. The psychological depth of his character – a mix of calmness, fearfulness, determination, and unspoken past neglect – could serve as a fertile ground for horror elements to flourish and provide a rich narrative experience.

His return to Massachusetts, under circumstances he's not entirely comfortable with, sets the stage for a story that could explore both supernatural and psychological horror themes. His reluctance hints at unresolved issues, possibly repressed memories or tensions that could be magnified by the horror elements in the game.

Incorporating familial dynamics into the horror context can also add layers to the gameplay and story. Spencer’s protective instincts towards his wife and children can drive the narrative forward, offering opportunities for players to engage with the game on an emotional level. The complexity of Spencer’s character and his fraught relationships, especially with his parents and potentially with Danny, can introduce moral choices and challenging dilemmas, enhancing player immersion.

Given Spencer's background and the setting of a familial visit gone awry, the game could incorporate elements like haunted family estates, sinister locals with their own dreadful secrets, or even psychological horrors stemming from Spencer's own unresolved issues. The Massachusetts setting additionally provides a rich backdrop, potentially allowing for the inclusion of New England folklore or Lovecraftian influences.

Overall, the depth of Spencer’s character and his family dynamics provides a promising foundation for a horror game that could engage players not just with scares, but with a compelling narrative that explores themes of family, trauma, and the horrors that lurk within human relationships. How do you envisage the horror elements manifesting in Spencer's journey, and how will his character's background influence the gameplay and the decisions players must make?
He has short brown hair, blue eyes and glasses. He wears a light blue plaid shirt, beige khakis and white sneakers. He is around 27 years old.

With the additional details about Spencer's physical appearance and age, you're building a more vivid and relatable character. At 27, he is young enough to be in the thick of raising a family and dealing with the complexities of adult life, yet old enough to have a history and past traumas influencing his actions and perspectives. His choice of attire—a light blue plaid shirt, beige khakis, and white sneakers—suggests a down-to-earth, relatable guy, perhaps someone who values comfort and practicality over fashion, which can help players connect with him as an everyday individual thrust into extraordinary circumstances.

Given Spencer’s described appearance and the dynamic you've set up with his family and background, consider how these elements could interact with the horror themes of your game:

1. **Visual Contrast**: Spencer’s unassuming and approachable look could provide a stark contrast to the horror elements he faces, making those elements feel even more jarring and unnatural by comparison. This visual disparity can heighten the sense of dread and unease, as players see someone who looks remarkably ordinary confronting the extraordinary and terrifying.

2. **Gameplay Mechanics Centered Around Family**: Spencer's role as a father and husband could deeply influence the gameplay mechanics. Protective instincts could translate into mechanics where Spencer must make decisions that ensure the safety of his family, potentially at the cost of his own well-being. This could introduce compelling moral dilemmas and elevate the emotional stakes of the game.

3. **Use of Glasses**: The detail that Spencer wears glasses could be used creatively within the game. For instance, scenarios where Spencer loses his glasses could momentarily impair vision for the player, adding to the suspense and vulnerability in critical moments. This could also be used to introduce puzzle elements, where players must find ways to compensate for or restore his vision to progress.

4. **Psychological Depth**: Spencer’s calm yet somewhat fearful demeanor, combined with his determination and the silent burden of his past, provides a rich psychological landscape for the narrative. The horror elements could be tailored to exploit his fears and anxieties, perhaps with supernatural or psychological manifestations that play on his guilt, regrets, or unresolved issues from his past. These personal horrors could be far more terrifying and impactful for both Spencer and the player, providing a deeply immersive experience.

5. **Environmental Interaction**: The setting you choose, be it a haunted family home in Massachusetts or other sinister locales, can reflect or contrast with Spencer's personality and appearance. An ordinary man in extraordinary circumstances allows for a lot of creative environmental storytelling, where the surroundings can either mirror his internal state or juxtapose it to highlight the horror elements.

By integrating Spencer’s physical characteristics and personal background into the gameplay and narrative, you can create a multi-layered horror experience that is both engaging and emotionally compelling. The challenge will be to balance the horror elements with the need for players to empathize and connect with Spencer on his journey, turning his story into one that's memorable and impactful.

One interesting mechanic is that the further the player progresses in the game's story, the bloodier Spencer gets. There are 5 levels, starting from 0 and ending at 4. Level 0 is fully clean, Level 1 has some blood on his hands and pants but nothing too messy, Level 2 has blood on his shirt and more blood on his hands and pants, Level 3 has even more blood and Level 4 is the bloodiest and although the player can't see it, the lenses on Spencer's glasses are somewhat cracked. This mechanic doesn't do anything but I added it because I thought it would make the game... more realistic, I guess.

Integrating a visual progression mechanic like Spencer becoming progressively bloodier as the story advances is a compelling way to enhance the atmosphere and emotional impact of your game. This mechanic not only adds to the realism but can also serve as a powerful narrative and psychological tool. Here are a few suggestions on how you might further leverage this mechanic to enhance the horror experience, even if it remains purely cosmetic:

**1. Emotional and Psychological Impact:** The gradual increase in bloodiness can serve as a stark visual representation of the ordeal and trauma Spencer is going through. This can make the experience more immersive for players, as they see the tangible effects of the horror unfolding around and upon Spencer. It’s a constant, visual reminder of the stakes and the dangers he faces.

**2. Environmental and NPC Reactions:** While the mechanic itself might not directly affect gameplay, it could indirectly influence it through how NPCs (Non-Player Characters) react to Spencer. For instance, characters could become more fearful, sympathetic, or repulsed based on Spencer's appearance, opening up or closing down dialogue options and possibly affecting the storyline or available missions.

**3. Immersion Through Detail:** The detail about the lenses of Spencer's glasses becoming somewhat cracked at the highest level of bloodiness is a fine touch that can deeply enhance immersion. It subtly implies the severity of his situation without explicitly stating it. Additionally, this could slightly alter the visual perception of the game, making the horror feel even more personal and immediate.

**4. Symbolism and Storytelling:** The levels of bloodiness can symbolize Spencer's descent into the horror of his situation, correlating with the game's themes or the revelation of his past and the darkness within. This visual cue could mirror his psychological state, becoming a storytelling tool that complements the narrative progression.

**5. Easter Eggs and Secrets:** Consider incorporating hidden details tied to the bloodiness level. For example, certain secrets or Easter eggs might only be visible or accessible when Spencer reaches a certain level of bloodiness. This could encourage players to explore different aspects of the game and add a layer of re-playability.

**6. Moral Implications:** If applicable, this progression could also hint at moral deterioration or the tough choices Spencer has to make. Players might reflect on their actions within the game and ponder how it affects Spencer both physically and morally, potentially leading to different endings based on these choices.

Although you've envisioned this mechanic as not directly impacting gameplay, its presence can significantly contribute to the atmosphere, immersion, and narrative depth of your horror game. By emphasizing the visual toll of the protagonist's journey, you're providing players with a continuous, impactful reminder of the game's stakes and themes.

Here's the deal... the hometown he lives in Massachusetts, has a cult problem. The main cult in this game is a cabal that calls themselves the Order. They are a doomsday cult. This cult, has a tradition, sacrificing a family member. Danny WAS to be sacrificed, however, something in the family happened that prevented his sacrifice and because of that, the pact with the Order has been broken.

Incorporating a doomsday cult, particularly one with macabre traditions like family sacrifices, immediately sets a deeply unsettling and horrific tone for your game. The backstory involving Spencer, Danny, and their family's interrupted pact with the cult, "The Order," lays a rich narrative foundation imbued with suspense, dark secrets, and potentially supernatural elements. Here are some ways to expand on this premise to create a gripping horror experience:

### Cult Details and Beliefs

Flesh out "The Order" by defining its beliefs, traditions, hierarchy, and goals. Understanding what they herald as the impending doomsday and how sacrificing a family member plays into their rituals or beliefs in averting, causing, or surviving this apocalypse can add depth to the story. This also opens pathways to explore how they've influenced or integrated into the town, such as positions of power, secret meetings, or how deep their roots go into the town's history.

### Family Secrets and Conflict

Spencer's return to his hometown and his family's broken pact with the cult could be the catalyst for unraveling deep, dark family secrets. This aspect can drive narrative tension, as Spencer uncovers truths about his parents, their involvement with the cult, and perhaps the real reason behind their favoritism towards Danny. This can lead to internal conflict within Spencer, fostering choices that impact the game's direction and endings.

### Cult Influence and Mechanics

The cult's influence over the town and its inhabitants could lead to eerie encounters, tense negotiations, and the unsettling realization that anyone, from the mailman to the mayor, could be a member of The Order. This can affect gameplay through trust dynamics, where Spencer must decide whom to confide in or seek help from, impacting story progression and character relations.

### Sacrificial Pact and Consequences

Diving deeper into the aborted sacrifice of Danny and its repercussions can create numerous narrative threads. Perhaps the pact was meant to ensure the family's prosperity or protection from a greater evil, and breaking it has unleashed sinister forces upon Spencer and his family. This can introduce elements of supernatural horror, where Spencer must protect his family from both the cult and whatever was unleashed due to the broken pact.

### Exploration and Puzzle Solving

Incorporate gameplay elements that involve exploring hidden cult locations, deciphering cryptic messages or rituals, and untangling the history between Spencer's family and the cult. This not only enriches the world-building but also engages players in actively piecing together the mystery.

### Moral Choices and Consequences

Spencer's interactions with cult members, decisions on safeguarding his family, and how he chooses to confront or unravel the cult's influence in the town can lead to a complex web of moral choices. These decisions can affect the gameplay, leading to multiple endings based on how Spencer navigates these moral quandaries, ranging from dismantling the cult, joining it to protect his family, or finding an alternative way to break free from the cult's influence.

### Supernatural vs. Psychological Horror

The game could balance supernatural horror elements linked to the cult's doomsday beliefs with psychological horror stemming from familial betrayal, secrets, and the terror of facing a deeply embedded societal menace. This dual approach can cater to fans of both horror sub-genres, creating a rich, multifaceted horror experience.

Developing these elements with careful attention to narrative coherence, atmosphere, and player agency can result in a horror game that's not just about jump scares but offers a deep, immersive story that stays with players long after they've finished playing.

But the traditional drug screening protocol is time-consuming, laborious and costly, keeping anti-cancer drug price up and resulting clinical shortage. To address these problems, an innovative microfluidic drug screening platform was developed, integrating with three functional models of rapid concentration gradient generation, reliable cancer model construction and convenient cell viability test. The traditional drug screening protocol used in systematic research of anti-cancer drugs is known to be time-consuming, laborious, and costly. These factors contribute to the high prices of anti-cancer drugs and result in a shortage in clinical settings. To overcome these challenges, an innovative microfluidic drug screening platform has been developed. This platform integrates three functional models: rapid concentration gradient generation, reliable cancer model construction, and convenient cell viability testing. By leveraging the flexibility of 3D printing technology, a unique spatial channel structure has been fabricated to enhance the mixing effect, resulting in faster generation of concentration gradients compared to current microfluidic generators.

In conclusion, a concentration gradient generator with complex three-dimensional microchannel was developed successfully, which provided an integrated, miniaturized and automated drug screening platform. It was diversely considered to improve working efficiency, reduce experiment cost and has great applied potential through anti-cancer drug research.

In summary, a successful development of a concentration gradient generator with a complex three-dimensional microchannel has led to the creation of an integrated, miniaturized, and automated drug screening platform. This platform is expected to significantly improve working efficiency, reduce experimental costs, and holds great potential for application in anti-cancer drug research.

conversation.content:
Omitting <descriptorRefs>
						<descriptorRef>jar-with-dependencies</descriptorRef>
					</descriptorRefs> from build in my pom.xml file seems to crash the build process. I just want the final builded jar to not have the with-dependencies suffix on it

The `<descriptorRefs>` element in the pom.xml file is used to specify which descriptors should be used during the build process. In this specific case, `<descriptorRef>jar-with-dependencies</descriptorRef>` refers to the Maven Assembly Plugin descriptor that packages all dependencies into a single jar file with the "-jar-with-dependencies" suffix.

If you omit `<descriptorRefs>` and `<descriptorRef>jar-with-dependencies</descriptorRef>`, it means that the Assembly Plugin will not be executed during the build process, resulting in the absence of the "with-dependencies" jar.

However, if omitting the `<descriptorRefs>` section is crashing your build process, it may indicate that there are other parts of your build configuration relying on the presence of the "with-dependencies" jar. It's important to analyze the build logs and error messages to identify the exact reason for the crash.

If you still want to exclude the "with-dependencies" suffix, you can try other methods like using the Maven Shade Plugin or configuring a custom assembly descriptor to achieve your desired packaging configuration.

conversation.content: What happens if I change the retention policy of a Microsoft Exchange mailbox that already has the mailbox archive enabled with the default policy?. The default policy archive everything older than 2 years. And I'm considering changing to a policy that archives everything older than 1 year

If you change the retention policy of a Microsoft Exchange mailbox from the default policy (archiving everything older than 2 years) to a new policy (archiving everything older than 1 year), the following will happen:

1. The new retention policy will be applied to the mailbox, superseding the default policy.

2. Any items that were previously moved to the archive under the default policy will remain in the archive.

3. The new policy will move items from the mailbox to the archive based on the new criteria. That is, any items older than 1 year will be moved to the archive, while items between 1 and 2 years will remain in the primary mailbox.

4. Moving forward, items will be archived once they reach the 1-year age, as specified in the new policy.

Keep in mind that it may take some time for the new policy to take effect and process items in the mailbox based on the updated criteria.

4. Moving forward, items will be archived once they reach the 1-year age, as specified in the new policy.

1. Web3j is a Java implementation of what popular library?
a. Web3
b. JSON-RPC
c. Ethereum
d. Solidity

2. How can web applications connect to Ethereum nodes using Web3j?
a. By using JSON-RPC or familiar standards like HTTP, WebSockets, and IPC
b. By using the official Solidity compiler
c. By using Truffle for compiling and deploying smart contracts
d. By using Meta-Mask or Infura for testing Ethereum networks
Answer: a. By using JSON-RPC or familiar standards like HTTP, WebSockets, and IPC

3. Ethereum is described as a cryptocurrency, distributed supercomputer, blockchain, and smart contract network written in which programming language?
a. Java
b. Solidity
c. Web3j
d. JavaScript
Answer: b. Solidity

4. What does each Ethereum node contain?
a. The entire history of the Ethereum blockchain
b. The compiled Solidity smart contract functions
c. A redundant backup of all the data
d. All of the above

a. org.web3j:core:3.3.1

a. truffle version

a. It represents the entire history of the Ethereum blockchain.

a. Web3j

a. getBlockNumber()

a. By calling getBlockNumber()

c. By calling getTransactionCount()

a. The address and the latest block parameter

a. By calling getBlockNumber()
b. By calling getEthAccounts()

18. What is the purpose of Java Smart Contract Wrappers in Web3j?

what does cue somebody in means

To "cue somebody in" means to give someone information about a situation that they were previously unaware of. It is commonly used in informal settings, such as in conversation with friends or coworkers. For example, "Can you please cue me in on what happened at the meeting?" means "Can you please give me an update on what was discussed during the meeting because I was not present?"

The current cost accounting method being used is the traditional cost accounting method. One notable difference between this method and the Activity-Based Costing System is the approach for allocating non-manufacturing and manufacturing costs. Here are four specific differences to consider:

1. In the ABC method, both non-manufacturing and manufacturing costs are assigned to products based on a cause-and-effect basis. This means that the ABC costing method accurately allocates Manufacturing Overhead (MOH) to the corresponding products, whereas traditional production costing does not allocate MOH to the correct products as it lacks cost drivers.
2. Unlike traditional costing, ABC does not allocate all manufacturing costs to products. Some manufacturing costs may be excluded from product costs under the ABC method.
3. It is important to note that the ABC costing method is not accepted by external financial reporting standards, such as Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP). Therefore, companies cannot utilize ABC to prepare their annual reports.
4. ABC costing utilizes both volume and non-volume bases, whereas traditional costing allocates all MOH using a volume-related allocation base. Consequently, traditional costing tends to overcost high-volume products and undercost low-volume products.

In the case of Cortland 1000, which has a higher volume resulting in longer manufacturing time, traditional costing leads to an overestimation of the MOH allocated to Cortland 1000.

October 6, 2023





By David Leonhardt






Differ we must


In our polarized society, the simple act of listening to people with whom you disagree — let alone working with them — can be grounds for rebuke.


The House Republicans who toppled Speaker Kevin McCarthy this week did so because he forged bipartisan compromises supported by most members of both parties. To the Republican rebels, negotiating with the opposition was a fireable offense.


A similar purism is evident in the spread of book bans targeting material on race and sexuality. In Florida, officials edited a textbook to remove a passage on George Floyd’s murder and the subsequent protests. In Georgia, after a children’s book author giving a talk to fifth graders mentioned that a historical figure was gay, school officials canceled the author’s remaining speaking schedule.


In yesterday’s newsletter, I focused on the specific dangers that extremist Republicans have created for American democracy. Today’s subject — intolerance of differing views — is both a right-wing and left-wing phenomenon. Like the hard-right House Republicans, modern progressivism has created a growing list of issues on which disagreement is unacceptable.


Some universities refuse to hire faculty members who won’t write statements supporting diversity programs. Activists vilify journalists who cover the difficult debate over whether children should undergo lasting gender-transition treatments. In the public health sector, more than 500 experts signed a petition portraying another expert as an unethical, fatphobic eugenics sympathizer — because she had questioned the wisdom of extended Covid lockdowns.


These attempts to enforce ideological purity tend to overlook an important bit of American history: Refusing to listen to the other side of a debate doesn’t have a very good record of success.


Change is messy


Over time, national heroes like Abraham Lincoln, Martin Luther King Jr. and Franklin D. Roosevelt acquire an image that’s a lot tidier than their real-life behavior was. They are sacralized. They’re treated as leaders who changed the country by transcending politics.


In truth, a defining feature of the country’s most effective leaders has been their embrace of messy politics, including a willingness to listen to, and work with, people whose views they do not share. Transformational leaders tend to be both radical and practical.


It was true of the founders and the suffragists, of Roosevelt and King. In a new book about Lincoln, Steve Inskeep, the NPR host, argues that this approach was a defining feature of Lincoln’s victory over slavery and his rescue of the nation. The book’s first sentence is, “Abraham Lincoln was a politician.”


He refused to isolate an abolitionist in Congress whom others considered extreme. He also worked with a leader of the anti-immigration Know Nothing party. The title of Inskeep’s book is “Differ We Must,” a reference to a line in a respectful letter that Lincoln wrote to a friend who refused to oppose slavery.


“If you’re going to defeat someone you think is doing something terrible, and also keep a democracy, you have to build a majority,” Inskeep said in an interview with Anand Giridharadas’s Substack newsletter. “And that might mean that you have to deal with people that you disagree with on some things, or many things, or even most things, but you find enough common cause that you can work with them on something.”


The counterargument is plain enough: that the other side in a political debate is so wrong that it doesn’t merit engagement. The other side is un-American, according to this view, or, to use a phrase now common on the political left, denies the humanity of others; it simply must be defeated.


The unanswered question, though, tends to be how it will be defeated.


In a democracy, victory requires winning enough votes to take power, which in turn requires persuasion. That doesn’t mean winning over most of your opponents. It does often mean winning over some of them. And it’s difficult to persuade others if you stop listening to them. “Had he failed to engage with people who differed, he would have not become the Lincoln we know,” Inskeep writes.


An abiding lesson of political change is that it’s usually accomplished by people who aren’t too pure to treat their opponents with respect. The new biography of King, by Jonathan Eig, contains evidence of the same point.


The recent history of the House of Representatives makes the point, too. Congressional Democrats have done the difficult, often unsatisfying work of compromising with each other and the Senate over the past 15 years — and along the way, they passed laws to expand health insurance, fund clean energy, build roads and semiconductor factories, and more. House Republicans have a less impressive list of accomplishments. When they have been in power, they have spent more time deposing their own leaders for being impure.
